sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Staples, Inc. will be held at the Teaneck Marriott at Glenpointe, 100 Frank W. Burr Boulevard,  Teaneck, New Jersey, on June 12, 2017 at 4:00 p.m., local time, to consider and act upon the following matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1)   To elect ten members of the Board of Directors to hold office until the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders or until their  respective successors have been elected or appointed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2)   To approve, on an advisory basis, named executive officer compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3)   To hold an advisory vote on the frequency of future executive compensation advisory votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4)  To approve the Companys Amended and Restated Executive Officer Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5)   To ratify the selection by the Audit and Finance Committee of Ernst & Young LLP as Staples independent registered  public accounting firm for the current fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6)   To transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting or any adjournment or postponement thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Developing an Effective Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Staples Board of Directors (the Board) has strong governance practices and is dedicated to continuous improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  seek to achieve an effective balance of relevant skills, experience, qualifications and personal qualities in Board composition,  and have significantly refreshed our Board in the past two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our priority is to bring areas of expertise together in the Staples  boardroom for the benefit of Staples and the creation of sustainable long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to ensure that the  Board and its committees are high-functioning, including through annual rigorous Board and committee evaluations.

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT SUMMARY BOARD AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE  DEVELOPMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Staples Board is committed to highly effective corporate governance that is responsive to shareholders, and on seeing to it  that the Company delivers on its strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Outreach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For many years, Staples has conducted a formal shareholder  outreach program to listen to investor perspectives on  corporate governance, our executive compensation program, sustainability and other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Twice yearly, we formally solicit feedback from institutional investors including asset  managers, public and labor union pension funds, and social
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: responsibility investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we engaged in constructive  dialogues over the course of the year with shareholders  representing approximately 40% of our shares outstanding,  and with proxy advisory firms, with direct involvement from  two of our directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Timeline of Selected Corporate Governance Events
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 > Threshold to call special shareholder meeting reduced from 25% to 15% of outstanding shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 > Executive Compensation  In response to shareholder feedback, changed the award structure for our performance share  awards to three-year cumulative goals instead of annual performance goals over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with  this change, adjusted the long-term incentive pay mix to be 2/3 performance share awards, and 1/3 restricted stock unit  awards that vest over three years, to bring us in line with market practice and facilitate recruitment and retention
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2015 > Implemented proxy access at 3%/3 years, through a by-law amendment to allow shareholder director nominations Adopted a formal severance policy to limit executive severance to 2.99 times base salary plus target annual cash  incentive award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy does not include equity awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2013 > Restructured our executive compensation program to increase performance-based elements in response to shareholder  feedback on compensation and to strengthen alignment with reinvention strategy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional corporate governance features are highlighted beginning on page 8 of this proxy statement.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Staples recognizes the close connection between our success and our ability to make a positive impact on society, our associates  and the planet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Giving back to communities, embracing a culture of diversity and inclusion, sustaining the environment, and  practicing sound ethics arent just the right thing to do.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These efforts help make us an employer and neighbor of choice, differentiate  our brand, and support profitable and responsible growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, visit www.staples.com/responsibility.

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, we launched our Staples 20/20 strategic plan with four key priorities to transform Staples and get our company back  to sustainable sales and earnings growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee of the Board sets rigorous financial metrics tied directly  to the success of our strategy and the creation of long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information about our strategy and 2016 highlights, see Business Overview in the CD&A section of this  proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to an executive compensation program that is consistent with current best practices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Things We Do Things We Dont Do  Strong alignment of pay and performance   89% of CEO compensation is at risk   Both short- and long-term programs include performance goals    Rigorous, objective financial metrics on annual and performance- based long-term awards that are closely tied to business strategy   Cumulative three-year goals in the long-term incentive program   3-year relative TSR modifier in performance-based longterm  awards    Strong stock ownership guidelines (5x salary for CEO, up to 4x  for other NEOs)    Double trigger change in control provisions in severance  agreements    Policy requiring shareholder approval for executive severance in  excess of certain limits   Clawback policy   Anti-hedging policy   No employment agreements    No excise tax gross-ups in executive severance  agreements   No pension plan  No private plane  Minimal executive perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to leading corporate governance practices that are in the best interests of our business and all of our  shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, we have:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pro-actively  adopted  many  important  governance  initiatives, such as majority voting, an enhanced political  contributions policy, a compensation recoupment policy  and our commitments to ethics, community and giving,  the environment and diversity and inclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Developed a successful shareholder outreach program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Demonstrated a consistent track record of listening and  responding thoughtfully to feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Outreach Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have conducted a formal corporate governance  outreach program for many years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We solicit feedback from  our institutional investors regularly, including from asset  managers, public and labor union pension funds and allied  organizations and social responsibility investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek  to hear perspectives on various governance matters, our  executive compensation program, sustainability and other  matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with prior practice, during the last year,  we engaged in constructive dialogues with shareholders  representing approximately 40% of our outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair of our Nominating and Corporate Governance  Committee and Chair of our Compensation Committee  participated in the outreach program and heard directly from  some of our shareholders and proxy advisory firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We share  the feedback we receive with our Nominating and Corporate  Governance Committee and Compensation Committee, as  well as with the entire Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elected Independent Chair of the Board  We have a  policy to require that we have an independent Chair of the  Board whenever possible, which would apply once Ronald  Sargent, our former Chairman and CEO, retired or no longer  served as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Sargent left at the end  of the 2016 fiscal year and our Board elected Robert Sulentic,  our then-serving Independent Lead Director, as Independent  Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive  Compensation    We  received  positive  shareholder feedback in 2016 for our recent enhancements  to our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular in 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We implemented 3-year cumulative goals in our long- term incentive program in direct response to shareholder  feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time we introduced restricted  stock units vesting over three years as 1/3 of our long- term incentive pay mix to bring us in line with market  practice and facilitate recruitment and retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recent Corporate Governance Enhancements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set our new CEOs total target compensation at the  25th percentile of our peer group companies, with the long- term incentive arrangement to be 100% performance- based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to feedback from our shareholders, our Board  made the following corporate governance enhancements over  the last year:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information about shareholder outreach with respect  to compensation matters, see the CD&A section of this  proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reduced Threshold to Call Special Shareholder Meeting   At our 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, a majority of our  shareholders voted for a shareholder proposal to reduce the  percentage of outstanding stock required for shareholders to  call a special meeting from 25% to 15%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reached out to  our shareholders in the fall of 2016 to hear their feedback on  the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to the shareholder vote and related  feedback, we amended our by-laws to reduce the threshold  from 25% to 15%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have not employed or otherwise compensated any  family members (within the meaning of the NASDAQ  listing standards) of the independent directors during the  past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors, in consultation with our Nominating  and Corporate Governance Committee, determines which of  our directors are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Guidelines provide that  directors are independent if they (1) meet the definition of  independent director under the NASDAQ listing standards  and (2) in our Boards judgment, do not have a relationship with  Staples that would interfere with the exercise of independent  judgment in carrying out their responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nominating  and Corporate Governance Committee periodically reviews the  independence standards in our Guidelines and recommends  changes as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the independent directors or their family  members is a partner of our independent registered public  accounting firm or was a partner or employee of such firm  who worked on our audit during the past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our executive officers is on the compensation  committee of the board of directors of a company that  has employed any of the independent directors or their  family members during the past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our Guidelines, our Board has determined  that all of our directors and nominees are independent except  Ms. Goodman, who is our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining independence,  our Board considered all the available relevant facts and  circumstances, including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No family relationships exist between any of our directors  or executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither we nor any subsidiary has employed or otherwise  compensated the independent directors other than for  service on our Board and its committees during the past  three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the past three years, none of our directors or  executive officers has had a material direct or indirect  business relationship with us or engaged in a related  party transaction as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED PARTY  TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our written Code of Conduct sets forth the general principle that our directors, executive officers and other associates  should avoid any situation that could be perceived as a  conflict of interest, regardless of the dollar amount involved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This principle is also reflected in our written Guidelines and the written materials that we use to educate associates  about conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, under the Guidelines,  if an actual or potential conflict of interest develops for any reason, including, without limitation, because of a change in business operations of the Company or because of a directors circumstances, the director should immediately report the matter to our General Counsel, who should then report the matter to the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee for review and determination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event there is  a significant conflict, the director should resign or the conflict must be resolved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, under the Guidelines, any director who wishes to join the board of directors of another  company must provide written notice to the chairperson of the  Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chair of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, after consultation with our General Counsel, will then  respond to the director with a resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also ask each of our executive officers and directors to fill out questionnaires  every year to help enable us to identify if a potential conflict  of interest exists.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code of Conduct, Guidelines and the charters for all the committees of our Board are available at www.staples.com in the Corporate Governance section of the Investor Information webpage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to companies or organizations affiliated with our current  independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All transactions reported with director- affiliated companies were in the ordinary course of business,  without involvement of the director and on arms length  business terms.

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for reviewing, approving or ratifying any related  party transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We define related party transactions  as transactions with a value of more than $120,000 and in which
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Staples and any of our directors, director nominees,  executive officers, 5% shareholders and their immediate family members are participants, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) such participants have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the course of reviewing whether or not the participants should be deemed to have a direct or indirect material interest, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee reviews the presence  of standard prices, rates, or terms consistent with arms- length dealings with unrelated third parties; the materiality of the transaction to each party; the reasons for entering into the transaction; the potential effect of the transaction on the status of an independent director; and any other factors the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee deems relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a transaction is deemed to be a related party  transaction, the procedures for approval or ratification of such a transaction are the same as for actual or potential conflicts of interests involving directors and are set forth in the Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors determines its leadership structure  annually based on a recommendation of the Nominating and  Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2017, Ronald  Sargent retired as Chairman of the Board and we elected  Robert Sulentic, our then-serving Independent Lead Director,  as Independent Chairman of the Board, in accordance with  our policy to require that we have an independent Chair of  the Board whenever possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that its  current leadership structure assures the appropriate level  of management oversight and independence, and that  Mr. Sulentics election as Independent Chairman will serve to  enhance the role he played as Independent Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides leadership to the Board, including in the event  of a crisis.

sentences.text: Coordinates the annual performance review of the CEO.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board also formed an Ad Hoc Committee to  assist the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee  by overseeing CEO succession planning, and considering  internal and external candidates for the position.

sentences.text: From March 2016 to  September 2016, when we announced the appointment of  Shira Goodman as our new, permanent CEO, the Ad Hoc  Committee met 15 times.

sentences.text: the integrity of the Companys financial statements, and  cybersecurity, including our response to significant data  security incidents.

sentences.text: At each quarterly Board meeting, the Audit  and Finance Committee reports to the Board on all of its  specific activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is ultimately responsible for reviewing  and approving our risk management strategy and framework  and key risk parameters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In terms of overseeing the broader  ERM program, the Audit and Finance Committee, under  powers delegated by the Board, is responsible for the review  and approval of our risk management framework and ensuring  that appropriate policies and practices are in place for risk  assessment and management, including that all risk areas  are being monitored by senior management, reported to the  Board or appropriate Board committee by senior management  and addressed as needed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee  also provides oversight with respect to risks relating to the  Companys accounting and financial reporting processes,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our most senior executives are responsible for collaborating  with the Audit and Finance Committee to provide oversight  of the risk management process and prioritize and validate  key risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is then responsible for implementing  the Board and Board committee approved risk management  strategy and for developing policies, controls, processes and  procedures to identify and manage risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior members of management make up our Enterprise Risk  Committee, which meets regularly to coordinate information  sharing and mitigation efforts for all types of risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee stays apprised of significant actual  and potential risks faced by Staples and the effectiveness of its risk assessment and management process in part  through detailed presentations at least twice a year from the  Vice President of Internal Audit as the representative of the Enterprise Risk Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, management presented to the Audit and Finance Committee the results of its enterprise wide review of the major financial, operational and legal risks facing the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the most important risks, the CFO  and Vice President of Internal Audit presented their mitigation strategies, which had been reviewed by the Enterprise Risk  Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also reviewed with the Audit and  Finance Committee its ERM methodologies for identifying and  prioritizing financial, operational and legal risks and discussed the top level risks and related risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: its discussions with our Vice President of Internal Audit to  inform its overall view of risk and approve the proposed audit  schedule for the internal audit group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our internal audit group  identifies, assesses and assists management in addressing  and managing risks by using the Integrated Framework by  the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway  Commission (2013), also known as the COSO framework.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee administers its risk  oversight role through the Board committee structure as  well.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Board committee is responsible for monitoring  and reporting on the material risks associated with its  respective subject matter areas of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit  and Finance Committee oversees risks related to our  accounting and financial reporting processes, the integrity  of our financial statements, capital policies and practices,  and financial transactions, the Nominating and Corporate  Governance Committee oversees risks related to corporate  governance, including director independence and related  party transactions, and as discussed in the CD&A section of  this proxy statement, the Compensation Committee oversees  risks related to our compensation programs, including  an annual review and risk assessment of the Companys  compensation policies and practices for all associates and  a risk assessment in connection with any changes to our  compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, as part of the ERM process, significant attention  was given to implementation of the Companys information  security strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee provides  oversight to management with respect to network security  enhancements and other projects underway by the Global  Technology team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent of the enterprise risk management process, the  Audit and Finance Committee is made aware of risks as a  result of being briefed in person regularly by our Vice President  of Internal Audit, as well as an annual briefing and quarterly  reports by our Director of Global Compliance on compliance  and ethics matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These reports also are provided to  the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee also meets  regularly with the General Counsel and at least quarterly, in  executive session, alone with the Vice President of Internal  Audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee uses the results of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board and the Audit and Finance Committee  receive presentations throughout the year from management  regarding specific potential risks and trends as necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At  each Board meeting, the Chairman and CEO addresses in  a directors only session matters of particular importance or  concern, including any significant areas of risk requiring Board  attention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the practices described above  facilitate effective Board oversight of our significant risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At its regularly-scheduled meeting in June of each year,  our full Board reviews the Companys near- and long-term  strategies in detail.

sentences.text: The meeting is typically held off-site  and includes presentations by and discussions with senior  management regarding strategic initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board remains  involved in strategic planning throughout the year, engaging  with management to review progress of and challenges to  the Companys strategy, and to approve specific initiatives.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIVERSITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity has always been very important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strive to  offer an inclusive business environment that offers diversity of  people, thought and experience, as well as diverse suppliers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This also holds true for our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is  committed to seek out highly qualified women and individuals  from diverse groups to include in the candidate pool of Board  nominees, as reflected in our Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Board  annually reviews the appropriate skills and characteristics  of the Board members in light of the current composition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of the Board, and diversity is one of the factors used in  this assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Not only does the Board view diversity of  experience, industry, skills and tenure as important, but also  of age, gender and ethnic backgrounds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2012, we have  added eight new directors to our Board.

sentences.text: SUSTAINABILITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to our governance best practices, we have  integrated leading environmental and social initiatives and  programs in all facets of our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are a recognized  leader in environmentally-friendly business practices and have  a long history of sourcing and selling eco-conscious products,  providing recycling and green services, maximizing our energy  efficiency and renewable use energy, and eliminating waste.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these efforts differentiate our brand, provide us  with a competitive advantage, and support our Staples 20/20  strategic priorities which include accelerating mid-market  growth in North America, rationalizing excess capacity and  preserving profitability in North American Retail, and driving  profit improvement and cost reduction across our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were the first company in our industry to offer a national  electronics recycling program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, we helped our  customers recycle more than 25 million pounds of office  technology and 50 million ink cartridges globally across  our markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With a large portfolio of facilities and vehicles, Staples  recognizes the significance of the energy usage and carbon  emissions impacts of our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reducing these impacts  has been a cornerstone of our long-term sustainability  initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we ended the year with 643 buildings  certified to the ENERGY STAR standard, which represents  51% of active buildings in the US.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By 2020, our goal is to  reduce electrical intensity by 25% and total carbon emissions  by 50% from 2010 levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we sold over $4 billion in products with environmental  features.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Staples has a growing portfolio of sustainable  products, including Staples Brand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These products help  meet the changing needs of our customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Today, Staples  offers more than 13,000 eco-conscious products across our  delivery and retail businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our strategic account leaders  and dedicated sustainable solutions managers can help  develop and execute sustainability programs for our Staples  Business Advantage customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Sustainability Center  on staples.com helps raise awareness about how to identify  eco-responsible products and makes it easy for customer to  directly shop for those products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also partner directly with more than 2,200 suppliers,  both large and small, to support a large, complex and  geographically diverse supply chain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For years, Staples has  worked with suppliers to advance and improve our offerings  of greener products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recently implemented smart-size  packaging to improve our customer experience and reduce  our carbon footprint to provide customized packaging tailored  for individual orders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This allows us to reduce corrugate use  by approximately 15% and void fill use by approximately 60%  across our entire US network.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to maintaining an effective Board that  represents the best interests of the Company and our  shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an annual director self-evaluation  process administered by our outside counsel to assess  director performance, Board dynamics and the effectiveness  of the Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the process, a  written survey is developed with input from the Independent  Chairman and each Board Committee Chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director  completes the survey and provides suggestions and feedback  to our outside counsel, who then summarizes the results  of the assessment and provides recommendations for  improvements, to our Independent Chairman and to each
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committee Chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process allows directors to  anonymously provide feedback on, among other things, (1)  Board information, planning, and oversight, (2) Board structure  and operation, (3) the Boards relationship with the CEO and  management, (4) Committee structure and operations, and (5)  director qualifications, preparedness and engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, as well  as the full Board, discusses these results in executive session  and uses them in determining the appropriate mix and skill set  for Board composition and the nomination process, as well as  addressing areas where the Board feels it can improve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR CANDIDATES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process followed by the Nominating and Corporate  Governance Committee to identify and evaluate director  candidates includes requests to Board members and others  for recommendations, engaging a professional recruiting firm  to help identify and recruit potential candidates, meetings  from time to time to evaluate biographical information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and background material relating to potential candidates  and interviews of selected candidates by members of the  Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and  our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance  Committee also considers the results of our robust Board self- evaluation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder-Recommended Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such information should be submitted to the Nominating and  Corporate Governance Committee, c/o Corporate Secretary,  Staples, Inc., 500 Staples Drive, Framingham, Massachusetts  01702.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assuming  that  appropriate  biographical  and  background material has been provided on a timely basis,  the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will  evaluate shareholder recommended candidates by following  substantially the same process, and applying substantially the  same criteria, as it follows for candidates submitted by others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may recommend an individual to the Nominating  and Corporate Governance Committee for consideration as  a potential director candidate by submitting the following  information: (1) the candidates name; (2) appropriate  biographical information and background materials regarding  the candidate; and (3) a statement as to whether the shareholder  or group of shareholders making the recommendation has  beneficially owned more than 5% of our common stock for  at least a year as of the date such recommendation is made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder-Nominated Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our proxy access by-law allows a shareholder, or a group of  up to 25 shareholders, owning 3% or more of our outstanding  common stock continuously for at least three years to  nominate and include in our proxy materials director nominees  constituting up to two individuals or 20% of the Board  (whichever is greater), provided that the shareholder(s) and the  nominee(s) satisfy the requirements specified in Article I, Section  7.4 of our by-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of any such nomination must be  received by the Corporate Secretary of Staples at 500 Staples  Drive, Framingham, Massachusetts 01702, not later than the  close of business on the ninetieth (90th) day, nor earlier than  the close of business on the one hundred twentieth (120th)  day, prior to the first anniversary of the preceding years annual  meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2018 Annual Meeting, notice of proxy access  nominations must be received no earlier than February 12,  2018 and no later than March 14, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the date
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of our 2018 Annual Meeting is more than 30 days before or  more than 70 days after such anniversary date, notice by the  shareholder must be received no earlier than 120 days prior to  the 2017 Annual Meeting and not later than the later of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the  90th day prior to the 2017 Annual Meeting and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the tenth  day following the day on which public announcement of the  date of the 2018 Annual Meeting is made or notice for the  2018 Annual Meeting was mailed, whichever occurs first.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, shareholders have the right under our by-laws to  directly nominate director candidates, without any action or  recommendation on the part of the Nominating and Corporate  Governance Committee or our Board and without such  candidates being included in the Companys proxy materials,  by following the relevant procedures summarized in this proxy  statement under the caption Shareholder Proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMMUNICATING WITH OUR BOARD
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board will give appropriate attention to written  communications that are submitted by shareholders, and will  respond if and as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Absent unusual circumstances  or as contemplated by the committee charters, the Chairperson  of the Board (if an independent director), or the Independent  Lead Director (if one is appointed), or otherwise the Chairperson  of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee,  with the advice and assistance of our General Counsel, is  primarily responsible for monitoring communications from  shareholders and other interested parties and for providing  copies or summaries of such communications to the other  directors as he or she considers appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: who monitors communications from shareholders and  other interested parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies or summaries of such  communications are provided to all directors, if such person  considers it important and appropriate for all directors to  know.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, communications relating to corporate  governance and corporate strategy are more likely to be  forwarded than communications relating to ordinary business  affairs, personal grievances and matters as to which we  tend to receive repetitive or duplicative communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in accordance with our Guidelines, if a meeting  is held between a major shareholder (including institutional  investors) and a representative of the independent directors,  the independent Chairman will serve, subject to availability, as  such representative of the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under procedures approved by our independent directors  and subject to the advice and assistance from our General  Counsel, communications are forwarded to the Chairperson of  the Board (if an independent director), the Independent Lead  Director (if one is appointed), or otherwise the Chairperson  of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the current directors consistently has demonstrated  their strong work ethic and dedication to Staples, including  coming prepared to meetings, asking insightful questions,  challenging managements assumptions, focusing on long  term business strategy, analyzing challenges, evaluating  solutions and overseeing implementation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of our Board are elected for a term of office  to expire at the next annual meeting (subject to the election  and qualification of their successors or the earlier of their  death, resignation or removal).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ten directors, constituting our  entire Board, are to be elected at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One  of our current directors, Carol Meyrowitz, is not standing for  reelection at the Annual Meeting and our Board therefore  determined to reduce the size of the Board from eleven to ten  upon her departure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the composition of the Board, including  the varied tenure of our directors, combines institutional  knowledge and understanding of our business model,  products and services and historical growth strategies with  fresh perspectives and exposure to alternative approaches to  business process, which promotes lively Board discussion and  effective oversight and problem solving.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering whether to recommend any particular candidate  for inclusion in our Boards slate of recommended director  nominees, the Nominating and Corporate Governance  Committee applies the assessment criteria set forth in our  Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These criteria include  diversity, age and skills such as understanding of the office  products market, the retail industry, e-commerce, finance,  accounting, marketing, technology, risk oversight, international  business and other operational and business knowledge  needed to oversee a global multi-channel business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  principal qualification of a director is the ability to act effectively  on behalf of all of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee  does not assign specific weights to particular criteria, and  no particular criterion is a prerequisite for any prospective  nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the specific skills, qualifications and  experience of our directors, considered as a group, should  provide a mix of knowledge and abilities that will allow our  Board to fulfill its responsibilities.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our nominees are current or former chief executive  officers, chairpersons, directors or senior executives of  large sophisticated corporations, educational institutions, or  investors in a broad range of corporations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, they have  a deep understanding of, and extensive experience in, many  areas that are critical to our operation and success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have  determined that nominees who have served in these roles have  extensive experience with one or more of financial statement  preparation,  compensation  determinations,  compliance,  corporate governance, risk oversight, public affairs and  legal matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Compensation  Committee  (the  Committee)  is  responsible for making recommendations to our Board with  respect to the compensation paid to our non-employee  directors (Outside Directors).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Outside Directors are  predominantly compensated through equity awards, reflecting  the Committees philosophy that director pay should be  aligned with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in our general industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews  an extensive analysis of marketplace practices for Outside  Director pay conducted by management and reviewed by the  Committees independent advisor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our equity  program for associates, the Outside Director compensation  program also reflects a value-based approach to equity  grants, in which the amount of the awards made to Outside  Directors is based on a fixed value rather than a fixed number  of shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the Committees goal to maintain a level of Outside  Director compensation at the median of companies both  within our peer group as well as similarly-sized companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Outside Director receives an annual equity grant equal  to $175,000 in the form of restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual  grants vest after one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the following Outside  Directors receive additional annual equity grants:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the  Independent Lead Director receives restricted stock units  with a value of $40,000;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) each chairperson of the Audit  and Finance Committee, Compensation Committee and  Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee receives  restricted stock units with a value of $32,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In each case,  these additional grants vest on the date of each of the four  regularly scheduled quarterly Board meetings that such  Independent Lead Director or chairperson holds such position  and are paid in shares on the one year anniversary of the  award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each Outside Director receives a quarterly  cash payment of $18,750 and is reimbursed for reasonable  expenses incurred in attending meetings of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  chairperson of the Audit and Finance Committee receives an  additional quarterly cash payment of $3,750.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, on the second business day following  the 2016 Annual Meeting, each of our Outside Directors  elected at the meeting received their annual restricted stock  unit grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares of restricted stock units to  be granted is determined by dividing the fixed value by the  closing price of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon  a change-in-control of Staples or upon a director leaving  our Board after reaching the age of 72, all of such directors  restricted stock units would fully vest and be paid out.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, each then-serving Outside Director voluntarily  declined half of the quarterly cash payment of $18,750 for the  next four quarters of their service as a director, in response to  the pressures on our share price in fiscal year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each such  director therefore temporarily received a reduced quarterly  cash payment of $9,375 in June, September, and December  of 2016, and March of 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Outside Directors receive a one-time initial grant of  restricted stock units equal to $150,000, which vests after  three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Feeny, Ms. Henretta and Mr. Lundgren  received this initial grant in 2016, on the second business day  following the 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 29, 2017, in line with the Companys previously  announced Independent Chair policy, Mr. Sulentic was elected  to the role of Independent Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Sulentic  has served as a Board Member since 2007 and in the role of  Lead Director since 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, in consultation with the independent  compensation consultant, reviewed the change in role in light  of compensation practices for the Independent Chair at peer  group and S&P 500 companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined  that an increase to Mr. Sulentics compensation would be  appropriate based on benchmarking data, but at the request of  Mr. Sulentic, did not proceed to recommend any adjustments  to his current pay as Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION AND  COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A)  describes how we design and manage our compensation  program, provides an overview of our business performance  and progress in 2016 with our Staples 20/20 strategy and  most importantly, demonstrates the strong link between pay  and performance for our Named Executive Officers (NEOs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CD&A is structured as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An  executive  summary,  including  our  business  performance and shareholder engagement in 2016 (p.27)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A presentation of compensation earned by our NEOs as a  result of this performance (p.31)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also present a summary of shareholder feedback, the  positive changes our Board has made to address this feedback,  and describe how we established the compensation structure  for our new CEO, appointed in September 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A detailed discussion of our 2016 compensation program  (p.34) followed by the processes we use in designing and  managing compensation (p.40)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional material relating to governance of our  compensation program such as policies relating to stock  ownership and recoupment (p.42)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I  EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guiding Principles of Our Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that executive compensation should be directly linked to performance and the creation of long-term value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The structure of our executive compensation program is  intended to enable the company to attract, retain and motivate  a talented management team to drive our business objectives  of both top line and bottom line results, as well as attractive  returns on capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our overall program, and in  particular our focus on granting performance-based awards, is  consistent with current best practices in compensation design.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this principle, as well as consultation with  shareholders, the Committee has developed annual and long- term incentive programs that are tied to objective, quantifiable,  and rigorous performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The metrics we use in our  incentive programs support the long-term alignment of pay  with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Staples is a world-class provider of products and services  that primarily serve the needs of business customers of all  sizes in seven countries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The overwhelming majority of our  revenue is generated in North America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed  to providing superior value to our customers through a broad  selection of products, easy to use websites and mobile  platforms, a differentiated salesforce, an integrated retail and  online shopping experience and a wide range of print and  marketing and technology services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the disposition of our  European business, at the end of fiscal year 2016 we operated  two business segments, North American Delivery and North  American Retail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our priorities are to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accelerate mid-market growth in North America
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Narrow our geographic focus to North America
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rationalize and preserve profitability of our North  American Retail stores
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Drive profit improvement and cost reduction across  the company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our North American Delivery segment (58% of total company  sales in 2016) consists of the U.S. and Canadian businesses,  including Staples Advantage, Staples.com, Staples.ca, and  Quill.com, that sell and deliver products and services directly to  businesses and consumers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our strategies for North American  Delivery focus on driving increased customer acquisition,  retention and share of wallet through our customized contract  offerings, our membership programs and expanding categories  beyond office supplies, with a particular focus on the mid- market customer segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are also focused on serving  our customers by evolving our team-based contract selling  model to be more unified and collaborative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are driving
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our vision is we help businesses succeed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This reflects a multi- year effort to evolve our company to become the product  and service destination for businesses in a rapidly evolving  and competitive marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, we introduced  our Staples 20/20 strategic plan with four key priorities to  transform Staples and get our company back to sustainable  sales and earnings growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are extremely focused on  allocating more resources to the businesses where we have  our strongest competitive advantages, and deemphasizing  our underperforming businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Were also prioritizing  innovation as a key catalyst to further differentiate Staples from  our competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT SUMMARY growth in categories beyond core office supplies by adding specialists who have expertise in selling products like facilities and break room supplies, furniture, promotional products and  technology products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: with products that are readily available and easy to find, and  knowledgeable sales associates to support customers while  preserving profitability through increased customer conversion,  cost reductions and growing our services businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our  goals are to continue to be a destination for core office supply  categories like ink, toner and paper as well as products and  services beyond office supplies, such as print and marketing  services, facilities and break room supplies and technology  products and services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our North American Retail segment (37% of total company  sales in 2016) consists of 1,255 stores in the United States  and 304 stores in Canada at year end.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our strategies for  North American Retail focus on offering easy-to-shop stores
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Staples 20/20 Strategic Priorities 2016 Staples 20/20 Accomplishments Accelerate mid-market growth in North America   Realigned our operating structure to better serve our  customers by aligning our delivery businesses and  mid-market customers within one business unit   Strengthened our differentiated approach to serving  mid-market customers by combining the strength of our  sales force with our digital expertise   Began scaling our membership programs, ending the  year with significantly increased numbers of mid-market  contract membership customers and small business  membership customers who shop on Staples.com  and Quill.com   Achieved double digit growth in sales beyond office  supplies in the mid-market contract business Narrow geographic focus to North America   Entered into an agreement to sell a controlling interest in  our remaining European operations to Cerberus Capital  Management during the fourth quarter of 2016 and this  transaction closed in early 2017   Sold our UK retail business and operations to Hilco   Acquired Capital Office Products, one of the largest  independent office products dealers in the U.S.   Partnered with Managed by Q to provide mid-market  contract customers in New York City, Chicago, San  Francisco and Los Angeles with an expanded offering  of office services Rationalize and preserve profitability of our North American  Retail stores   Continued to rationalize excess capacity in retail  network through 48 store closures and reduce risk by  shortening the average remaining lease life per store in  North America   Increased customer conversion in both U.S. Stores and  Canadian Stores   Drove growth in print and marketing services   Continued to simplify the operating environment for  our retail retail stores, and generate additional  efficiency savings across the company in 2017  and 2018

sentences.text: For several years, Staples has conducted a comprehensive  shareholder outreach program.

sentences.text: Our Board values the  opportunity to engage directly with our shareholders to hear  their thoughts, better understand their views and represent  their interests.

sentences.text: As a result of this program, over the past  several years, the Board has made significant enhancements  to our corporate governance and compensation programs  including proactive adoption of key governance initiatives and  restructuring compensation to increase alignment between  pay and performance.

sentences.text: In 2016, we reached out to the top 200 institutional investors,  representing 86% of shares outstanding.

sentences.text: dental, vision, disability, and supplemental life insurance.

sentences.text: We also have an Executive Benefits Program for all  senior officers of Staples, including the NEOs, consisting  of life insurance, long-term care insurance, a survivor  benefit plan, and an executive physical program; as well  as a legacy supplemental long term disability benefit in  which Ms. Goodman is the only NEO who continues  to participate.

sentences.text: Ms. Goodman was provided this benefit  before she was appointed CEO.

sentences.text: Retirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have a pension plan in which our NEOs  participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, our NEOs are eligible to participate  in defined contribution retirement income plans that are  fully funded by the NEOs and supported by Staples  through limited matching contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are eligible to participate in our 401(k) qualified  plan on the same basis as our other salaried associates;  however, their contributions are limited to 2% of eligible  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the limitations on our officers  ability to contribute to our 401(k) plan, we maintain  the Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (SERP),  which is a non-qualified deferred compensation plan  intended to provide comparable benefits above the  applicable limits of our 401(k) qualified plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the  SERP , officers of Staples may defer a total of up to 90%  of their base salary and bonus and receive matching  contributions up to a maximum of 4% of base salary  and bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2016, the Committee scaled back the  Executive Benefits Program by eliminating the non- standard life insurance, long-term care insurance and  executive physical benefits for employees hired on or  after January 1, 2017, and reducing the amount of  the benefit available to them under the survivor benefit  plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For current employees, the Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) froze  the amount of the benefit available to them under the  non-standard life insurance benefit and the survivor  benefit plan as of December 31, 2016,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) eliminated  the executive physical benefit as of May 2017, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) eliminated the company reimbursement for their  long-term care insurance benefit as of July 2017 (with  some exceptions for employees over 65 years of age).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: III  COMPENSATION PROCESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the companys philosophy that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salaries and incentives should be referenced to median  peer group practices, but when making decisions about  compensation levels, the Committee relies upon its  judgment and not on rigid guidelines or formulas
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay should be performance-based, so that excellent  results yield relatively high pay and poor results yield  relatively low pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has established a number of processes to help ensure that our executive compensation program meets its  objectives and is consistent with the pay philosophy described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These processes also helped to inform the design of the  2016 Compensation Program described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Committee charter authorizes the Committee to engage  independent legal and other advisors and consultants as it deems necessary or appropriate to carry out its responsibilities  and prohibits the Committees compensation consultants from serving as Staples regular advisors and consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our 2016 fiscal year, the Committee continued to use Exequity  LLP as an independent advisor to advise on and assist the Committee with executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of its written agreement, Exequity is responsible for, among other matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing total compensation strategy and pay levels  for executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performing competitive analyses of outside board  member and CEO compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Examining all aspects of executive compensation  programs  to  assess  whether  they  support  the  business strategy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the terms of the written agreement and the  Committee charter, Exequity has, with the knowledge and  consent of the Committee, provided input to management on  matters to be presented by management to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exequity has not performed services for Staples that were  unrelated to Committee matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, with the  Committees approval, Exequity assisted management  by providing compensation data related to executive and  non-executive positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most of the data reviewed by the  Committee is generated by management and reviewed  and advised upon by the compensation consultant.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting the Committee in staying current on the latest legal, regulatory and other industry considerations affecting executive compensation and benefit programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing general advice to the Committee with respect  to all compensation decisions pertaining to the CEO  and all compensation recommendations submitted  by management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During our 2016 fiscal year, the independent consultant  performed these responsibilities and met with the Committee  in executive session without the presence of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exequity was also engaged to support the Compensation  Committee with analysis and recommendations with respect  to appropriate target annual compensation for Ms. Goodman
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees typical practice is to review NEO  compensation on an annual basis at its regularly scheduled  meeting in December of each year, ahead of the beginning of  the new fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee typically benchmarks each  NEOs compensation against data and analysis provided by  management and the independent compensation consultant  based on current proxy statement data from our peer group,  and taking into account the Companys performance,  shareholder feedback, and the results of our Say-on-Pay  advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary  New CEO Compensation section of this CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the departures of Messrs. Sargent and Wilson in 2016,  the expectation that Ms. Goodman would be reviewing our  management structure as part of her transition to the new role,  the Committees previous extensive analysis of current NEO  compensation, and the fact that our Senior Vice President and  Corporate Controller and Executive Vice President and Chief  Legal Officer were not expected to be NEOs going forward,  the Committee did not make any changes to the executive  compensation for our other NEOs and determined that its  typical benchmarking would not be productive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Committee met in executive session and  engaged the independent compensation consultant to provide  benchmarking analysis and recommendations with respect to  Ms. Goodmans target compensation in connection with her  appointment to the CEO role on an interim basis in June, and a  permanent basis in September, as described in the Executive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, in December 2016 the Committee focused on the  competitiveness of base salary, total cash compensation (base  salary plus annual cash bonus) and total long-term incentive  compensation levels that would potentially be associated with  Ms. Goodmans new management structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews our peer group extensively every three  years, the last review being conducted in 2015.

sentences.text: These changes  were designed to ensure the overall peer group was more  appropriately aligned with Staples from a revenue and market  capitalization perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The peer group analysis was conducted by the Committees  independent compensation consultant, using a proprietary  model to compare the fit of each of the peer group  companies to Staples profile based on industry, company  size, market valuation, and performance.

sentences.text: Compensation Analysis & Conclusions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section describes the Committees analysis and conclusions relating to the overall level of compensation for our CEO and  other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please refer to the Executive Summary  Shareholder Feedback and Board Response and New CEO Compensation sections of this CD&A for a full description of how Ms. Goodmans total target compensation as CEO was determined.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation at Target - Based on the analysis of peer  group CEO compensation provided by the independent  compensation  consultant,  the  Committee  set  target
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation for Ms. Goodman at the 25th percentile of our  peer group companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other NEO Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in the Compensation Process  Benchmarking  section of this CD&A, the Committee had previously  been provided with extensive analysis with respect to the  compensation of our other NEOs over the preceding years,  and did not engage in further detailed benchmarking in  2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee had previously taken steps to align  Ms. Komolas target compensation more closely with the 50th  percentile of the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Ms. Goodman finalized the management structure for  2017, the Committee were asked by management at the  December meeting to instead review the appropriate target  compensation for two expected executive officer roles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the  role of Vice Chairman and Chief Administrative Officer, which  was filled in January 2017 by an external candidate, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the  President, North American Delivery role, which was filled by an  internal candidate at the beginning of fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conclusions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed and established the target  compensation for our CEO, appointed in September 2016  and determined that the overall target compensation was  appropriate, given the target compensation agreed was  a significant reduction versus the target compensation of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the prior CEO and that it aligned with the 25th percentile  of Staples peer group companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also  determined that the 2016 compensation for the other  NEOs continued to be appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IV  OTHER MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination Scenarios
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Committee  regularly  reviews  all  compensation  components for our NEOs, including salary, bonus, current  vested and unvested long term incentive compensation, the  current value of owned shares, and cost of all perquisites and  benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee periodically examines  similar information for other senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Documentation detailing the above components and  scenarios with their respective dollar amounts was prepared  by management for each of our NEOs and reviewed by the  Committee in March 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This information was prepared  based on compensation data as of the end of fiscal year 2016  and assumed that the various scenarios occurred at the end of  fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar termination scenario information with  respect to our 2016 fiscal year is presented under the heading  Potential Payments upon Termination or Change-in-Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviews the projected payout obligations  under potential retirement, termination, severance, and  change-in-control scenarios to fully understand the financial  impact of each of these scenarios to Staples and to  the executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, the Committee found the total  compensation for each of our NEOs under these various  scenarios to be reasonable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many factors were considered,  including, but not limited to, the contributions of the executive to  Staples, the financial performance of Staples, the marketplace  and the particular contemplated scenario.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Input from Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain officers within our Human Resources department  regularly attend Committee meetings to provide information  and recommendations regarding our executive compensation  program, including the Executive Vice President of Human  Resources and Vice President of Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: other senior executives.
